title_full: CMOBPER01-BP01 Confirm critical components of the connected vehicle platform
title: Confirm critical components of the connected vehicle platform
description: Identify critical components including in-vehicle and cloud data planes (data ingestion, edge processing, cloud ingestion), control planes (in-vehicle and cloud compute), and consuming applications (mobile apps). Break down applications into microservices that can be managed and scaled independently.
outcome: Well-defined architecture with identified data planes, control planes, and consuming applications

title_full: CMOBPER01-BP02 Enforce performance data collection
title: Enforce performance data collection
description: Continuously collect, monitor, and analyze performance data using CloudWatch to track metrics and logs, set alarms, and get insights into application behavior. Use cloud-native tools to review resource health, performance, and optimization recommendations. Track cost per vehicle metric.
outcome: Comprehensive performance monitoring with actionable insights and cost tracking

title_full: CMOBPER02-BP01 Define key metrics for connectivity testing
title: Define key metrics for connectivity testing
description: Define metrics including latency, bandwidth, data consistency, and uptime across different connectivity methods (LTE, Wi-Fi, satellite, no connection). Simulate various environments and connection states. Implement logic to persist critical versus non-critical data during connection loss.
outcome: Validated performance across all connectivity scenarios with proper data prioritization

title_full: CMOBPER02-BP02 Check data consistency across various connection states
title: Check data consistency across various connection states
description: Ensure that data is consistent across various connection states, especially when transitioning between them.
outcome: Consistent data handling during connectivity transitions

title_full: CMOBPER02-BP03 Evaluate fail-over and redundancy
title: Evaluate fail-over and redundancy
description: If one connection method fails, verify the system seamlessly switches to another available method with proper fail-over and redundancy mechanisms.
outcome: Resilient connectivity with automatic fail-over between connection methods

title_full: CMOBPER03-BP01 Evaluate performance and scalability
title: Evaluate performance and scalability
description: Assess current performance metrics, conduct load/stress/scalability testing, implement performance monitoring, project future demands, evaluate infrastructure capacity, optimize databases, consider geographical distribution, ensure redundancy and failover, gather feedback, and understand service limits. Keep 30% capacity available for future needs.
outcome: Validated scalability to accommodate future vehicle demand projections

title_full: CMOBPER04-BP01 Implement steps for third-party integration performance assessment
title: Implement steps for third-party integration performance assessment
description: Map integration data flows and dependencies, establish baseline metrics, perform load and stress testing, assess dependencies, verify data integrity, evaluate security and compliance, and monitor for bottlenecks.
outcome: Optimized third-party integrations with validated performance

title_full: CMOBPER04-BP02 Collect key performance metrics for third-party integrations
title: Collect key performance metrics for third-party integrations
description: Assess scalability, latency, throughput, resilience, resource utilization, interoperability, monitoring capabilities, and total cost of ownership.
outcome: Comprehensive performance metrics for third-party integrations

title_full: CMOBPER05-BP01 Address irregular data traffic patterns efficiently
title: Address irregular data traffic patterns efficiently
description: Implement dynamic scaling, QoS mechanisms, caching and data aggregation, rate limiting, redundancy and fail-over, traffic analysis, SLA monitoring, geographical distribution, user experience monitoring, and testing for irregular patterns.
outcome: Resilient architecture handling irregular traffic patterns without SLA impact

title_full: CMOBPER05-BP02 Take into account that mobility patterns can vary significantly
title: Take into account that mobility patterns can vary significantly
description: Consider factors like peak commuting hours, weekends, holidays, climatic conditions, and unexpected events. Implement dynamic scaling, QoS, caching, rate limiting, redundancy, traffic analysis, and geographical distribution.
outcome: Architecture optimized for variable mobility patterns and temporal traffic variations

title_full: CMOBPER06-BP01 Consider data regulatory requirements
title: Consider data regulatory requirements
description: Account for data privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA), data localization requirements, data retention policies, and their impact on performance including additional processing steps like encryption or anonymization.
outcome: Compliant architecture with performance considerations for regulatory requirements

title_full: CMOBPER10-BP01 Build a cost-effective solution that is scalable and easy to manage
title: Build a cost-effective solution that is scalable and easy to manage
description: Use in-memory cache (Redis or MemoryDB) for top 50 properties with <200ms latency, NoSQL (DynamoDB) for next 500 properties with microsecond latency, and data lake for 5000+ properties with seconds or higher intervals. Implement managed services for high-performance computing workloads.
outcome: Tiered data architecture optimized for performance and cost based on access patterns

title_full: CMOBPER11-BP01 Use self-managed systems (Amazon EC2)
title: Use self-managed systems (Amazon EC2)
description: Use EC2 for compute, load balancing for traffic distribution, and auto scaling for right-sizing. Use AMIs to create and save configurations for easy scaling, replacement, or upgrades.
outcome: Flexible compute infrastructure with automated scaling capabilities

title_full: CMOBPER11-BP02 Use container-based architectures
title: Use container-based architectures
description: Use ECS or EKS for highly scalable container orchestration supporting Docker containers. Use Fargate for serverless compute without managing clusters. Use container orchestration to manage lifecycle for updates or rollbacks without downtime.
outcome: Scalable containerized applications with simplified infrastructure management

title_full: CMOBPER11-BP03 Use serverless technologies
title: Use serverless technologies
description: Use Lambda to run code without managing servers, paying only for compute time consumed. Use API Gateway for creating, deploying, and managing APIs. Implement versioned deployments allowing easy rollbacks.
outcome: Cost-effective serverless architecture with automatic scaling

title_full: CMOBPER12-BP01 Implement comprehensive monitoring and logging with notifications
title: Implement comprehensive monitoring and logging with notifications
description: Ensure all services report metrics and logs. Regularly review and adjust monitoring strategy. Derive actionable insights from collected data.
outcome: Actionable insights from comprehensive end-to-end monitoring

title_full: CMOBPER12-BP02 Implement device monitoring at edge, data transmission, cloud services, and log monitoring
title: Implement device monitoring at edge, data transmission, cloud services, and log monitoring
description: Establish alerts for workloads, applications, databases, load balancers, and network monitoring. Notify SRE team when thresholds are breached. Define KPIs like round-trip time and network latency between vehicle and cloud.
outcome: Comprehensive monitoring across all layers with defined KPIs and alerting

title_full: CMOBPER13-BP01 Follow best practices when creating dashboards
title: Follow best practices when creating dashboards
description: Use user-centric design, prioritize key metrics, use appropriate visualizations, add interactive elements, set consistent refresh rates, integrate alerting, and gather feedback for iterative improvement.
outcome: Effective dashboards providing actionable insights to stakeholders

title_full: CMOBPER13-BP02 Use tools and best practices to gain insights
title: Use tools and best practices to gain insights
description: Ensure end-to-end visibility, set meaningful alerts, enable anomaly detection, regularly review metrics and logs, monitor security threats, and optimize costs. Use CloudWatch insights, container insights, and serverless insights.
outcome: Comprehensive visibility with anomaly detection and cost optimization

title_full: CMOBPER14-BP01 Develop criteria where trade-offs can be made based on functionality type
title: Develop criteria where trade-offs can be made based on functionality type
description: For infotainment functionality, certain tradeoffs are acceptable (e.g., configurable retry actions to avoid draining battery). For vehicle safety critical OTA updates, tradeoffs should not inhibit delivery. Ensure predictive maintenance data collection is not hindered. Develop revision process on actionable insights from monitoring.
outcome: Clear tradeoff criteria balancing performance, cost, and safety requirements

title_full: CMOBPER14-BP02 Make informed architecture design trade-offs
title: Make informed architecture design trade-offs
description: Consider self-managed options, AWS managed services, and serverless options. Each brings scalability, higher performance, and faster response but with cost implications. Categorize functions, vehicle signals, states, and software updates by processing and storage needs.
outcome: Optimized architecture balancing performance, scalability, and cost
